div.p: As distributed via SchoolMessenger: Mar 24, 2020, 12:30 PM

We want you to know that while we hope for a resumption of the normal in-person school year, it has been communicated to us by the Commissioner of Education, State Government and local public health officials that we should plan for continued online learning for the remainder of the school year. Last week I shared we would be closed through April 3rd. With this new information in mind, District 145 will now be closed indefinitely. This means we are not anticipating students being back in our buildings the rest of this school year for classes. At this time, all activities will be suspended. This closure will be periodically reviewed based on information from the health officials’ monitoring of COVID-19 and advice from the Department of Education and the Governor’s office. If anything changes, we will let you know. For now, and the remainder of the school year, all of our learning will take place online.

I would also like to share additional information related to our district closure. Our focus now as a district is to keep all students, parents, staff and community members safe from the spread of the COVID-19 virus. Not only do we want to do a great job educating our students online while they are home, we also want to try and keep everyone safe as well. For now, please stay home and practice social distancing to prevent the spread of the virus.

At this time, our school buildings will be closed to the public. If you have a question that you would typically call a building on, simply call our building phone numbers and they will be picked up by the appropriate office staff. This includes our building principals and secretaries. Our buildings will continue to have custodial and maintenance personnel present. However, this time will be limited each day. If staff members need to enter a building, they must ask permission from their building principal to do so.

Our food service program will continue at Eagle and WIS. This program will run from 11:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m. Monday through Friday. Yesterday was the first day of this program and it seemed to work well as we served lunch and breakfast to roughly 150 students. If anything changes with this program, we will let you know.

Our Central Office will have limited hours starting tomorrow, Wednesday, March 25th. Starting tomorrow, the Central Office will be open from 9:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. daily. These hours can be flexible depending on your own schedules. Just let us know if you need us to be here a little earlier or later and we can be flexible.
Additional information will come out soon on future school board meetings that will be held through online measures.

We appreciate the positive messages and kind words that have been directed towards our district the past few weeks. Even though this is a challenging time for everyone, our district will make it through this situation stronger than before.

Please continue to email or contact us with questions you have with online learning or anything else you have a question on. We appreciate your flexibility and understanding at this time. Please take care of your families and know we are here to help along the way.
